13.Samy Mahdy: We storified upon you their information with the right. They were guys who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

14.Samy Mahdy: And We fastened upon their cores, when they stood up, so they said, “Our Lord is the skies Lord and the earth; we will not call without Him a god, then we already said then, an atrocious lie.”

15.Samy Mahdy: “These, our kinfolk, have taken without Him, Gods. Why do they not bring upon them, by obvious Sultan? So, who was more oppressor than he who slandered lies against Allah?”

16.Samy Mahdy: “And when you have been isolated from them, and from what they were worshiping, except Allah, so shelter toward the cave. And your Lord will propagate for you from His mercy and will accommodate for you from your matter a facility.”

17.Samy Mahdy: And you see the sun, when it rises, visit their cave sporadically towards the right, and if it sets, lend them to the left, and they are in a cavity among it. That was from Allah’s verses. And whoever Allah guides so he is the guided one; and whoever He strays him, so you will not find for him a conductor guardian.

18.Samy Mahdy: And you assume them awake, while they are asleep. And We flip them over to exactly the right, and to exactly the left, and their dog stretched its arms by the threshold. If you look at them, you will turn away from them in flight, and be filled with terror from them.

19.Samy Mahdy: And thus, We raised them, to let them ask between themselves. A speaker among them said, “How long did you tarried?” They said, “We have tarried a day, or some of a day.” They said, “Your Lord is a knower with what you have tarried.” “So, mission one of you with your papers (Silver coins), these, to the city, so let him observe which food is refined, so let him bring to you a livelihood from it. And let him be gentle and let no one feel you.”

20.Samy Mahdy: “If they are arising upon you, they will be stoning you, or returning you back into their creed; and you will not be gaining then, ever.”

21.Samy Mahdy: And thus, We caused them to be discovered, to let them know that Allah’s promise is true, and that the Hour there is no doubt in it. When they were disputing their matter between them, So they said, “Build over them a building.” Their Lord is a knower with them. Those who overcame, upon their matter said, “We will take over them a Masjid.”

22.Samy Mahdy: They will say, “Three, and their fourth is their dog.” And they will say, “Five, and their sixth is their dog,” throwing with the unseen. And they will say, “Seven, and their eighth is their dog.” Say, “My Lord is a knower with their number.” None knows them except a few. So do not skepticize in them except an obvious skeptic, and do not seek ruling within them, among anyone.

23.Samy Mahdy: And never say for a thing, “I will do that tomorrow.”

24.Samy Mahdy: Except that, “Allah wills.” And remember your Lord if you forget, and say, “Perhaps my Lord will guide me nearer from this, a righteous guidance.”

25.Samy Mahdy: And they tarried in their cave for three hundred lunar years and increased nine.

26.Samy Mahdy: Say, “Allah is knower with what they tarried.” For Him the skies’ unseen and the earth. By Him see and hear. They have not without Him among a guardian, and He does not share in His judgment, a one.

27.Samy Mahdy: And recite what was revealed to you from your Lord’s Book. There is no one to alter His words, and you will not find without Him a haven.

28.Samy Mahdy: And yourself be patient with those who are calling their Lord in the early morning and the evening, wanting His Face. And do not, put away your eyes about them, wanting the Dunya Life’s adornments. And do not obey who We set his core inattentive about Our reminder and he followed his desire, and his matter was wastage.

29.Samy Mahdy: And say, “the right is from your Lord. So, whoever willed, so will believe. And whoever willed, so will disbelieve”. Surely, We have prepared for the oppressors, a Fire, surrounded with them, its marquee. And if they succor, they are succored with water like molten brass, roasting the faces. Wretched is the drink, and badness is accommodation.

30.Samy Mahdy: Surely those who believed and worked the righteous deeds, surely, We are not wasting the wages of whoever excelled his work.

31.Samy Mahdy: Those for them are Eden Paradises, beneath which the rivers are running. Ornament therein with bracelets from gold and will wear green garments from fine silk and brocade. Reclining therein on adorned couches. Gracious is the reward and finest is accommodation.

32.Samy Mahdy: And cite for them an example of two men. We set up for one of them two paradises from vine, and We edged them with palm-trees, and We set up between them vegetation.

33.Samy Mahdy: Both paradises brought their food, and not oppressed among it, a thing. And We burst a river through them.

34.Samy Mahdy: And there was fruitage for him. So, he said to his friend, while he conversed with him, “I am greater than you in money, and mightier in persons.”

35.Samy Mahdy: And he entered his paradise, while he oppressed himself. He said, “I do not assume that this will ever be eradicated.”

36.Samy Mahdy: “And I do not assume the Hour is established. And even if I returned to my Lord, I would find better than it, as resorts.”

37.Samy Mahdy: His friend said for him, while he conversed with him, “Have you disbelieved with the one who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then He normalized you, a man?

38.Samy Mahdy: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I never associate with my Lord anyone.

39.Samy Mahdy: And why not when you enter your paradise, you say, “As what Allah willed (Masha Allah); there is no power except with Allah”? If you see me, I have less than you, money and progeny.

40.Samy Mahdy: So, perhaps my Lord will give me better than your paradise, and send upon it thunderbolts from the sky, so it becomes slippery barren.

41.Samy Mahdy: Or its water becomes deep-well, so you are unable to request it.”

42.Samy Mahdy: And ruin was encompassed by his fruitage, and so he became overturning his hands for what he had spent in it, while it was empty upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone.”

43.Samy Mahdy: And it was not for him a group victorying him without Allah, and he was not victorious.

44.Samy Mahdy: There the guardianship is for Allah, Al-Haq (The Right). He is the best in reward and best consequence.

45.Samy Mahdy: And cite for them an example of the Dunya (present) life: as like water that We send down from the sky; so was mixed with it the earth’s plant; so, it becomes broken, the winds scatter it. And Allah is ever, over everything competent.

46.Samy Mahdy: The money and the progeny are the adornments of the Dunya (present) life. And the righteous remaining deeds are more goodness with your Lord in rewards, and more goodness in hope.

47.Samy Mahdy: And on a Day when We move the mountains; and you see the earth prominent; and We mustered them, so We do not depart from among them anyone.

48.Samy Mahdy: And they presented upon your Lord in a row. “You have already come to Us as We created you for the first time. Nay, but you claimed that We will not set up an appointment for you.”

49.Samy Mahdy: And the Book was positioned, and you will see the criminals are apprehensive from what was in it. And they are saying, “Woe to us! What is the matter of this book, it does not leave a small or a big, except it has enumerated it?” And they found what they had worked for was present. And Your Lord has not oppressed anyone.

50.Samy Mahdy: And when We said to the angels, “prostrate for Adam.” So, they prostrated, except for Iblis. He was from the jinn, so he debauched about his Lord’s command. So, are you taking him and his offspring as guardians without Me, while they are an enemy for you? Wretched it is for the oppressors as an exchange.

51.Samy Mahdy: I did not let them witness the skies creation and the earth, nor creation of themselves; and I was not taking the misleaders as assistants.

52.Samy Mahdy: And on a Day when He will say, “Call on My associates whom you have claimed.” Then they will call on them, so they do not respond to them. And We set up wrecking barriers between them.

53.Samy Mahdy: And the criminals saw the Fire, so they assumed that they would be fallen into it. And they did not find a diversion from it.

54.Samy Mahdy: And We have already diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every example, and the human was the most argumentative of anything.

55.Samy Mahdy: And what prevented the people from believing when the guidance has come to them, and seek their Lord’s forgiveness? Except that the former’s route (Sunnah) should come to them, or the torment should come opposite them.

56.Samy Mahdy: And We do not send the messengers except as preachers and Warners. And those who disbelieved argue by the invalid, to disprove by it the right. And they took My Verses, and what they were warned as mockery.

57.Samy Mahdy: Who is more oppressor than who is reminded with his Lord’s verses, so he turned away from them, and forgot what his hands have forwarded? Surely, We set up upon their cores, shields lest they understand it, and in their ears a load. And if you call them to the guidance, they will not be guided, then ever.

58.Samy Mahdy: And your Lord is Al-Ghafor (The Forgiver), Possessor of the Mercy. If He takes them with what they have earned; He would hasten the torment for them? Nay, but they have an appointment they will not find asylum other than it.

59.Samy Mahdy: And these villages, We destroyed them when they oppressed, and We set up for their destroying an appointment time.

60.Samy Mahdy: And when Moses said to his guy, “I will not cease until I reach the two seas junction, or I continue going for periods of time.”

61.Samy Mahdy: So, when they reached a junction between them, they forgot their fish. So, it took its pathway into the sea, slipping away.

62.Samy Mahdy: So, when they passed, he said to his guy, “Bring us our lunch; we already met from our journey - this, painful fatigue.”

63.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Have you seen when we sheltered into the rock? So, I forgot the fish. And none made me forget to remember it except Satan. And it took its pathway within the sea, wonder.”

64.Samy Mahdy: He said, “That is what we were seeking.” So, they returned, retracing upon their footsteps.

65.Samy Mahdy: So, they found a slave among Our slaves, We gave him from Us a mercy, and We taught him knowledge from Our presence.

66.Samy Mahdy: Moses said for him, “May I follow you upon, that you teach me from what you have been taught a righteous guidance?”

67.Samy Mahdy: He said, “You will not be able to be patient with me.

68.Samy Mahdy: And how will you be patient upon what you do not encompass with it a knowledge?”

69.Samy Mahdy: He said, “You will find me, if Allah wills, a patient; and I will not disobey a command for you.”

70.Samy Mahdy: He said, “So, if you follow me, do not ask me about a thing, until I narrate for you from it a reminder.”

71.Samy Mahdy: So they launched. Until, when they had embarked in the ship, he holed it. He said, “Did you hole it, to drown its inhabitants? You already brought an awful thing.”

72.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Did I not say that you will not be able to be patient with me?”

73.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Do not censure me with what I have forgotten, and do not overstrain me from my matters, difficulty.”

74.Samy Mahdy: So they launched. Until, when they met a lad, so he killed him. He said, “Did you kill a refined soul, without a soul? You already brought a denial thing.”

75.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Did I not say to you that you will not be able to be patient with me?”

76.Samy Mahdy: He said, “If I ask you about a thing after this, then do not accompany me. You already have notified from my presence, an excuse.”

77.Samy Mahdy: So they launched. Until, when they came to a village’s inhabitants, they asked them for food, so they refused to guest them. So, they found a wall in it that wanted to be collapsed, so he built it. He said, “If you are willing, you could take a wage.”

78.Samy Mahdy: He said, “This is a parting between you and between me. I will inform you with an interpretation of what you could not be patient on.

79.Samy Mahdy: As for the ship, it was for needy persons working in the sea. So, I wanted to blemish it and there was a king behind them taking every ship by usurpation.

80.Samy Mahdy: And as for the lad, so his parents were believers, so we were awed that he would overstrain them in tyranny and infidelity.

81.Samy Mahdy: So we wanted that their Lord replaces for them a goodness than him in refinement, and nearer in mercy.

82.Samy Mahdy: And as for the wall, it was for two orphaned lads in the city. And it was underneath it a treasure for them. And their father was a righteous man. So, Your Lord wanted them to reach their strength, and exit out their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it on my command. That is an interpretation of what you were unable to be patient on.”

83.Samy Mahdy: And they are asking you about Zul-Qarnain. Say, “I will recite upon you from him a reminder.

84.Samy Mahdy: We enabled him on the earth, and gave him, from everything a reason.

85.Samy Mahdy: So, he followed a reason.

86.Samy Mahdy: Until, when he reached the sun set place, he found it set in a dark mud spring, and found kinfolk at it. We said, “O Zul-Qarnain, you may either torture, or take a goodness, in them.

87.Samy Mahdy: He said, “As for whoever oppressed, so we will torture him, then he will be returned to his Lord, so He will torture him, an awful torment.

88.Samy Mahdy: “And as for whoever believed and worked righteous, so for him the excellent reward, and We will say for him from Our command an ease.

89.Samy Mahdy: Then he Followed a reason.

90.Samy Mahdy: Until, when he reached the sunrise, he found it rises upon a kinfolk for whom We do not set up for them a screen without it.

91.Samy Mahdy: And thus, and We already encompassed, with what he had of news.

92.Samy Mahdy: Then he Followed a reason.

93.Samy Mahdy: Until, when he reached between the two dams (Mountains), he found without them a kinfolk who could not almost understand a saying.

94.Samy Mahdy: They said, “O Zul-Qarnain, that Yagog and Magog are spoiling the earth. So., can we set up for you a tribute, in order to set up between us and them a dam?

95.Samy Mahdy: He said, “What my Lord has enabled me within it is goodness. So, aid me with power, I will set up a back-fill between you and them.”

96.Samy Mahdy: “Bring me the iron’s blocks.” Until he had leveled up between the two cliffs, he said, “blow.” Until when he set it up as fire, he said, “Bring me a molten copper to pour over it.”

97.Samy Mahdy: So they could not scale over it, and they couldn't hole it.

98.Samy Mahdy: He said, “This is a mercy from my Lord. So, when my Lord's promise comes, He will set it up into rubble, and my Lord’s promise is ever a true.”

99.Samy Mahdy: And on that Day, We left some of them surge into some others. And it was blown in the Trumpet, so We will gather them, gathering.

100.Samy Mahdy: And We presented Gohanam on that day for the infidels, a presentation.

101.Samy Mahdy: Those whose eyes were in cover from My reminder, and they were not able to listen.

102.Samy Mahdy: Are those who disbelieved assume that they take My slaves without Me, as guardians? We have prepared Gohanam (Hell) for the infidels, as a lodge.

103.Samy Mahdy: Say, “Shall We inform you with the most work losers?

104.Samy Mahdy: “Those whose striving in the Dunya (this world) life was strayed, while they are assuming that they excel at making.”

105.Samy Mahdy: Those who disbelieved with their Lord’s verses and His meeting. So, their work is inhibited. So, on The Resurrection Day, We do not value them, a weight.

106.Samy Mahdy: That is their penalty, Gohanam (Hell) with what they disbelieved, and took My verses and My messengers as mockery.

107.Samy Mahdy: Surely those who believed and worked the righteous deeds, were for them Al- Ferdous Paradises as a lodge.

108.Samy Mahdy: Immortals therein, do not seek other transference than it.

109.Samy Mahdy: Say, “If the sea was ink for my Lord’s words, the sea would run out, before my Lord’s words run out,” even if We bring with the likeness of it, as extension.

110.Samy Mahdy: Say, “I am only a humankind like you, being revealed to me, that your God is only One God. So, whoever expects to meet his Lord, So, he should work a righteous work, and never associate with his Lord’s worshiping anyone.”

1.Samy Mahdy: Kaf, Ha, Ya, Ayn, Saad.

2.Samy Mahdy: 2. Mentioned Your Lord’s mercy, His slave Zechariah.

3.Samy Mahdy: 3. When he called out his Lord, a hidden call out.

4.Samy Mahdy: He said, “O my Lord, surely the bones are feeble from me, and the head is flamed with gray hair, and I was not with your calling, my Lord, unhappy.

5.Samy Mahdy: “And I fear the loyalists from after me, and my woman is barren. So, endow me, from your presence, a guardian.

6.Samy Mahdy: To inherit me, and inherit from Jacob’s folks, and make him O my Lord, satisfied.”

7.Samy Mahdy: O Zakariya: Surely, We preach (Good tidings) of a lad whose name is Yahya; to whom We have not previously set up a name (like him).

8.Samy Mahdy: He said, “My Lord, how will be for me a lad, while my woman was barren, and I already reached from an old age, an extremity?”

9.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Thus your Lord said, ‘it is easy on Me, and I already created you before, and you were not a thing.’

10.Samy Mahdy: He said, “My Lord, set up for me a verse.” He said, “Your verse is that you will not talk to the people for three nights, consecutively.”

11.Samy Mahdy: So, he exited out upon his kinfolk, from the prayer niche, so he revealed to them that you glorify in morning and evening

12.Samy Mahdy: “O John (Yahya), Take the Book with force,” and We gave him the judgment as a boy (child).

13.Samy Mahdy: And a tenderness from our presence, and a refinement. And He was pious.

14.Samy Mahdy: And a devoter to his parents; and he was not a disobedient, mighty.

15.Samy Mahdy: And peace be upon him on a day he was born, and on a day, he dies, and on a day, he is raised alive.

16.Samy Mahdy: And mentioned in the Book Mary, when she withdrew from her family to an eastern place.

17.Samy Mahdy: So, she took without them a veil, so We sent to her Our spirit, So He be alike to her as a normal humankind.

18.Samy Mahdy: She said, “I am incanting with Al-Rahman (The Widely merciful) from you if you are a pious.”

19.Samy Mahdy: He said, “I am only your Lord’s messenger to endow for you a refined lad.”

20.Samy Mahdy: She said, “How will I have, a lad while no humankind has touched me, and I was not a trollop?”

21.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Thus your Lord said, ‘it is easy on Me, and We will set up him as a verse for the people, and a mercy from Us. And it was a decreed command.'“

22.Samy Mahdy: So, she conceived him, so she withdrew with him to a far place.

23.Samy Mahdy: So, the labor-pains brought her to a palm-tree's trunk. She said, “O I wish I had died before this, and been a forgotten derelict.”

24.Samy Mahdy: So, he called her from underneath her: “Do not grieve; your Lord has already set up a stream underneath you.

25.Samy Mahdy: And shake towards you with the palm-tree's trunk, it will drop upon you, ripe dates.”

26.Samy Mahdy: “So eat, and drink, and cool your eyes. And if you see among the humankind a one, so say, ‘I have vowed a fast forAl-Rahman (The Widely merciful), so I will not talk to a human Today.'“

27.Samy Mahdy: Then she brought him to her kinfolk, carrying him. They said, “O Mary, you have brought a slander thing.

28.Samy Mahdy: O Aaron’s sister, your father was not a bad person, and your mother was not a trollop.”

29.Samy Mahdy: So, she pointed to him. They said, “How can we talk to whoever was in the cradle, a boy (infant)?”

30.Samy Mahdy: He said, “I am Allah’s slave. He has given me the Book, and set up me, a prophet.

31.Samy Mahdy: And has set me blessed wherever I was; and has enjoined me with the prayers and the Zakat, as long as I live.

32.Samy Mahdy: And be devoted to my mother, and He did not make me unhappy, mighty.

33.Samy Mahdy: And the peace is upon me on a day, I was born, and on a day, I die, and on a day, I am raised alive.”

34.Samy Mahdy: That is Jesus, Mary’s son, the right saying, which they are within it skeptic.

35.Samy Mahdy: It was not for Allah to take a son, glorified is Him. If He decreed a command, So, only He says for it, “Be,” and it is.

36.Samy Mahdy: And surely “Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.”

37.Samy Mahdy: So, the parties differed between them. So, woe to those who disbelieved, from a Great Day Scene.

38.Samy Mahdy: Listen to them and see on a Day they come to Us. But the oppressors Today are in obvious astray.

39.Samy Mahdy: And warn them of The Regret Day, when the matter was decreed, and they are within an inattentive (state), and they are not believing.

40.Samy Mahdy: Surely, We who inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they are returning.

41.Samy Mahdy: And mention, in the Book Abraham. He was a truthful man, prophet.

42.Samy Mahdy: When he said for his father, “O my father, why do you worship which neither hear, nor see, nor avail about you, a thing?

43.Samy Mahdy: O my father, it has already come to me from the knowledge that has not come to you. So, follow me, and I will guide you on an even path.

44.Samy Mahdy: O my father, do not worship Satan. Surely Satan was disobedient to Al-Rahman (The Widely merciful).

45.Samy Mahdy: O my father, I am fearing that a torment from Al-Rahman (The Widely merciful) will touch you, so you become for Satan, a guardian.”

46.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Did you not desire my Gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. And abandon me for a long time.”

47.Samy Mahdy: He said, “Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you; Surely, He was ever gracious with me.

48.Samy Mahdy: And I will isolate, from you, and from what you are calling without Allah. And I will call my Lord, perhaps I am not with my Lord’s calling, unhappy.”

49.Samy Mahdy: So, when he isolated them, and from what they were worshiping without Allah, We endowed him, Isaac and Jacob. And both We set up as a prophet.

50.Samy Mahdy: And We endowed, for them from our mercy, and We set up for them a high truthful tongue.

51.Samy Mahdy: And mention, in the Book Moses. Surely, He was sincere. And He was a messenger prophet.

52.Samy Mahdy: And We called out to him from the right side of Al-Tur (The Mount), and We neared him in secret talk.

53.Samy Mahdy: And We endowed him from our mercy, his brother Aaron, a prophet.

54.Samy Mahdy: And mention, in the Book Ishmael. He was truthful of the promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.

55.Samy Mahdy: And he was commanding his family with the prayers and the Zakat, and he was at his Lord, satisfied.

56.Samy Mahdy: And mentioned in the Book Enoch (Edris). He was a sincere prophet.

57.Samy Mahdy: And We raised him to a high place.

58.Samy Mahdy: Those were the ones upon whom Allah graced over them among the prophets, among Adam’s offspring and among whoever We carried with Noah, and among Abraham’s offspring and Israel, and among whoever We guided and elected. If Al-Rahman’s verses (The Most Gracious) were recited upon them, they fell down prostrating and weeping. ۩

59.Samy Mahdy: So, they were succeeded by successors after them who wasted the prayers and followed the desires. So, they will meet an error end (Ghaya).

60.Samy Mahdy: Except whoever repented, and believed, and worked righteous. So, those are entering The Paradise, and not being oppressed anything.

61.Samy Mahdy: Eden Paradise which Al-Rahman (The Widely merciful) promised for His slaves with the Unseen. Surely His promise will be coming.

62.Samy Mahdy: They will not hear therein, chatter, except a peace. And for them their livelihood therein in the morning and evening.

63.Samy Mahdy: That is the Paradise which We inherit, among our slaves, who were pious.

64.Samy Mahdy: “And We do not descend except with your Lord’s command. For Him is what is between our hands, and what is behind us, and what is between that. And Your Lord is never forgetful.”

65.Samy Mahdy: Lord of the skies and the earth, and what is between them. So, worship Him, and be patient for His worship. Do you know anyone who is like His name?

66.Samy Mahdy: And the human says, “Is it, if I am dead, will I exit alive?”

67.Samy Mahdy: Does the human not remember that We created him before, and he was not a thing?

68.Samy Mahdy: So, by your Lord, We will be mustering them, and the devils, then We will bring them around Gohanam (Hell), upon their knees.

69.Samy Mahdy: Then, We will snatch from each sect those who are strongest insolent uponAl-Rahman (The Widely merciful).

70.Samy Mahdy: Then surely, We are more knowledgeable by those who most deserve to be flamed by it.

71.Samy Mahdy: And there is none from you except he is incoming to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

72.Samy Mahdy: Then We will save those who were pious, and leave the oppressors, in it upon their knees.

73.Samy Mahdy: And when our verses are recited as proofs upon them, those who disbelieved said to those who believed, “Which of the two teams is goodness in station, and best council?”

74.Samy Mahdy: And how many generations have We destroyed before them, who were better furnishings and appearance?

75.Samy Mahdy: Say, “Whoever is in the astray, so Al-Rahman (The Widely merciful) will extend for him an extension.” Until, when they saw what they were promised, either the torment, or The Hour. So, they will know who was in an evil place and weaker troops.

76.Samy Mahdy: And Allah increases those who are guided, a guidance. And the everlasting righteous deeds are more goodness with your Lord, and best restoration.

77.Samy Mahdy: So, have you seen the one who disbelieved with our verses, and said, “I will be given money and progeny”?

78.Samy Mahdy: Has he perused the Unseen, or has he taken with Al-Rahman (The Widely Merciful) a covenant?

79.Samy Mahdy: No! We will write what he says and will be extending for him among the torment an extension.
